title: Document Google OAuth configuration keys, dev defaults, and override guidance

requirements.summary: Update documentation to describe Google OAuth configuration keys, dev defaults, and how to set them for local and production without changing existing auth flows.
acceptanceCriteria: Documentation is added/updated (README and/or existing configuration docs) to list: GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI, FRONTEND_OAUTH_REDIRECT.
Docs include sensible dev defaults and explain how to override them for real Google OAuth credentials.
Docs include an explicit note that this change does not modify existing authentication settings or flows.

file_operations.description: Add a new subsection under Backend Configuration documenting the four Google OAuth configuration keys (GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI, FRONTEND_OAUTH_REDIRECT), including their purpose, sensible non-empty dev defaults, where developers should set/override them for local development vs production, and an explicit note that existing authentication settings/flows are unchanged.

Extend local development and production deployment instructions to reference the Google OAuth configuration keys and point to the configuration documentation section, including a clear reminder that this configuration step does not alter existing authentication behavior.
